title: Heterogeneous interactions and transformations of dibasic esters with indoor relevant surfaces
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, 26,582-594
DOI: 10.1039/D3EM00542A, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Cholaphan Deeleepojananan, Jinxu Zhou, Vicki H. Grassian
Dibasic esters, indoor air pollutants emitted from furniture coatings, readily adsorb to surfaces thus initially decreasing their gas phase concentrations but then slowly desorb leading to possible long term exposure.
